animes.tags: Fantasy, Action, Drama
animes.title: Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood

animes.tags: Oh my god the giant cgi titan is looks so fucking stupid, this is pure comedy. MAL is right, best season yet.
animes.title: Shingeki no Kyojin Season 3 Part 2

animes.tags: Unless you're under the control Lelouch's Geass, I can't see why you'd like this new season. Nonsensical plot, stilted dialogue, characters reduced to sex objects, hilariously bad. Saved by the ending.
animes.title: Code Geass: Hangyaku no Lelouch R2

animes.tags:
Fun time, but great characters and a good sense of tone.
 A sci-fi classic that goes beyond anime.
animes.title: Cowboy Bebop

animes.tags: Like most great films, it offers plenty to read into. Imaginative, beautiful, emotional, and most of all, it's so entertaining.
animes.title: Mononoke Hime

animes.tags: Addictive YA "fight the power" resistance story. Fun enough to be watchable but it's self confidence isn't backed up by thoughtful results.
animes.title: Code Geass: Hangyaku no Lelouch

animes.tags: More of the same with an extra helping of epicness added. Visually its not much better than its predecessor. It creates enough explosive action set pieces with emotional context to understand why it was so loved.
animes.title: Boku no Hero Academia 2nd Season

animes.tags: It was fun while it lasted, but it's clearly winding down into the same sort of stuff as the previous seasons.
animes.title: Boku no Hero Academia 3rd Season

animes.tags: Action, Comedy
animes.title: One Punch Man

animes.tags: It's an ufotable action show. Fantastic fights and great animation overall. Not into the story because it's moving too slow and the characters aren't very fleshed out yet. Episode 19 was a gem.
animes.title: Kimetsu no Yaiba

animes.tags: Comedy, Action, Drama, School, Shounen
animes.title: Ansatsu Kyoushitsu 2nd Season

animes.tags: The best dating sim adaptation that isn't Steins;Gate
animes.title: Fate/Zero 2nd Season

animes.tags: IGGY!!!!
animes.title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 3: Stardust Crusaders 2nd Season

animes.tags: Colorful, exciting, fun, creative. I liked it, but I wish there was more depth to it beyond being a visual treat. Nice morals to be learned, generally good vibes and likable characters.
animes.title: Mob Psycho 100

animes.tags: I'm going to rewatch this... eventually.
animes.title: Baccano!

animes.tags: Nice action, great animation, simple plot. The cast of angsty teenagers is so annoying and boring, thankfully most of them are cannon fodder to be killed.
animes.title: Shingeki no Kyojin

animes.tags: I could praise its technical achievement for years, but at the end of the day, the feeling it conveys is indescribable. Like the gems themselves, the show also traverses new narrative depths finding oddly impactful but unrecognizable emotions, Review
animes.title: Houseki no Kuni (TV)

animes.tags: More unabashedly ridiculous than the first season. It still takes itself too seriously, but it's more flashy and fun.
animes.title: Shingeki no Kyojin Season 2

animes.tags: Akane is a good lead and Kogami’s a good sidekick, but I wish the others were more developed. Feels like the scooby-doo of the cyberpunk-procedural genre. Recommended if you want good social commentary set to a cool cyberpunk backdrop.
animes.title: Psycho-Pass

animes.tags: Predictable, cliche, underdone side characters, but good messages and lead characters. Nice visual style as well. The predictability makes the show more comfortable to watch. Hits some emotional beats.
animes.title: Boku no Hero Academia

animes.tags: Great visuals, good,  thrilling action, goofy plot well realized by a grounded setting and believable characters.
animes.title: Fate/Zero

animes.tags: Mediocre take on a classic story setup. Some really interesting themes tied to Joe's rise through Megalonia, but they're dropped entirely by the end, Review
animes.title: Megalo Box

animes.tags: More of the cool dude doing cool things. Even more predictable than the show, but still entertaining.
animes.title: Shingeki no Kyojin: Kuinaki Sentaku

animes.tags: Is this yaoi?
animes.title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken (TV)

animes.tags: Really frustrating. I hate Shiro. He used to be just bland Mr. Everbody and I was fine with that, until they started balancing the story on his character. His arc is underdeveloped in areas so it shatters under the weight of a whole season.
animes.title: Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works 2nd Season

animes.tags: It feels wrong to say this, but it's outdated. Despite having an interesting story and characters it leans to hard on ambiguity and sexualization. Still, it's deserving of cult status, you could sort through it forever.
animes.title: Koukaku Kidoutai

animes.tags: I didn't care for the writing, but it's still a visual treat.
animes.title: Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works

animes.tags: What happens after we die? Who knows... But this show is so fucking awful that it might push you to find the answer yourself.
animes.title: Angel Beats!

animes.tags: Moody thriller through fun cartoony lens, sometimes it misses beats when the tone is mismatched but usually it's entertaining with enough teenage wonder to offer introspection.
animes.title: Durarara!!

animes.tags:
Enjoyable. 
The ecchi stuff doesn't get in the way unless it's done tastelessly.
animes.title: Nanatsu no Taizai

animes.tags: Cool!
animes.title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 3: Stardust Crusaders
Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works Prologue

animes.tags: Comedy, School, Action, Shounen
animes.title: Ansatsu Kyoushitsu

animes.tags: Very cool action show, funky super power stuff that isn't super well explained. I like the overdone edgy aesthetic but the rest of the show just aims to be cool rather than dark.
animes.title: Darker than Black: Kuro no Keiyakusha

animes.tags: I don't love the show, but this isn't a good alternative to it. Just a simple recap with very few newly added scenes that warrent a viewing. I would only recommend this movie to die hard fans who want to get caught up for the new series.
animes.title: Code Geass: Hangyaku no Lelouch I - Koudou

animes.tags: Drop that shit like a rock and never look back.
animes.title: Darling in the FranXX

animes.tags: Beautiful background art, nice grunge aesthetic. The story is paced very fast, the rules of the world are loosely defined, but the characters all great. The blend of comedy and horror is awesome.
animes.title: Dorohedoro

animes.tags: Photorealistic backgrounds and detailed fight scenes look good, but it's just as poorly written as the first season.
animes.title: Sword Art Online Movie: Ordinal Scale

animes.tags: Funnier than the first season, dynamic pace that feels way smoother than the first season, better world building and character writing, better directing/animation. The episodic format sometimes works against it, but there were more good episodes than meh.
animes.title: Kekkai Sensen & Beyond

animes.tags: Pointless waste of time. Shameless self indulgence that seems to have garnered a lot of cult attention. I didn't care for it but I could see why someone would.
animes.title: FLCL

animes.tags: I was pretty bored, it tried at least.
animes.title: Overlord

animes.tags: Action, Comedy-Drama, Mystery, Super Power
animes.title: Tiger & Bunny

animes.tags: Scary, funny, thrilling, timely, impactful. Pure insanity. Alienating at first, but that's the director pulling you into the experience. Perhaps lacking in depth from a writing perspective, but it does enough else to make up for it.
animes.title: Devilman: Crybaby

animes.tags: Pretty goos shounen, but compared to Fire Force this gold; great art style an animation, much less forced fan service. The writing is quite generic and cliche, yet the characters are all endearing and memorable.
animes.title: Soul Eater

animes.tags: More overlord/wishfufillment, Review
animes.title: Overlord II

animes.tags: One of the first I saw, didn’t care for it even then.
animes.title: Tokyo Ghoul

animes.tags: Surprisingly my first Gundam, thankfully it's quite accessible.
animes.title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Iron-Blooded Orphans

animes.tags:
Fun show, drags during the middle but always strives to
 entertain.
animes.title: Kuroshitsuji

animes.tags: Fantasy, Action, Drama
animes.title: Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood

animes.tags: It made me cry and taught me lessons pretty well.  That might not be enough for some, but it was for me. Will rewatch.
animes.title: Clannad: After Story

animes.tags: High art, low brow.
animes.title: Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai?: Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen

animes.tags:
Fun time, but great characters and a good sense of tone.
 A sci-fi classic that goes beyond anime.
animes.title: Cowboy Bebop

animes.tags: More of the same with an extra helping of epicness added. Visually its not much better than its predecessor. It creates enough explosive action set pieces with emotional context to understand why it was so loved.
animes.title: Boku no Hero Academia 2nd Season

animes.tags: It was fun while it lasted, but it's clearly winding down into the same sort of stuff as the previous seasons.
animes.title: Boku no Hero Academia 3rd Season

animes.tags: Adult humor for teenagers, entertaining camp with melodrama throughout. Not particularly deep in any way and the art is mediocre for the time it was released. Repetitive, but an easy watch with great comedy.
animes.title: Great Teacher Onizuka

animes.tags: Action, Comedy
animes.title: One Punch Man

animes.tags: Doubles down on everything that made the series good, minus the filler and fluff.
animes.title: Suzumiya Haruhi no Shoushitsu

animes.tags: Comedy, Action, Drama, School, Shounen
animes.title: Ansatsu Kyoushitsu 2nd Season

animes.tags: The kind of show that demands your attention and proves that it deserves it.
animes.title: Yojouhan Shinwa Taikei

animes.tags: Basically a normal episode stretched out to feature length. There are some good parts but a lot of pointless and boring ones too. Only about Megumin and Kazuma. Their relationship is kind of unnerving.
animes.title: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!: Kurenai Densetsu

animes.tags: Colorful, exciting, fun, creative. I liked it, but I wish there was more depth to it beyond being a visual treat. Nice morals to be learned, generally good vibes and likable characters.
animes.title: Mob Psycho 100

animes.tags: I'm going to rewatch this... eventually.
animes.title: Baccano!

animes.tags: It made me fall asleep but I think that was the point.
animes.title: Tonari no Totoro

animes.tags: Predictable, cliche, underdone side characters, but good messages and lead characters. Nice visual style as well. The predictability makes the show more comfortable to watch. Hits some emotional beats.
animes.title: Boku no Hero Academia

animes.tags: Not really my cup of tea I guess, idk what I was expecting with ecchi. Some of the games were fun.
animes.title: No Game No Life

animes.tags: A super pleasant, comfortably predictable rom-com that's content with being simple. Well done characters, tone, and pace.
animes.title: Toradora!

animes.tags: Drama, Comedy, Psychological, Romance
animes.title: NHK ni Youkoso!

animes.tags: It is more of the same
animes.title: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo! 2

animes.tags: Wonderful. Well made iyashikei that's relaxing but not boring, calming atmosphere and soft aesthetic, it teaches about camping as well. Simple but likable characters.
animes.title: Yuru Camp△

animes.tags:
Pokes fun at murder mystery tropes, until it actually just imitates them and does nothing with it. Meh ending that doesn't pull anything 
together.
animes.title: Kuroshitsuji: Book of Murder

animes.tags: I don't remember what happened
animes.title: Yoru wa Mijikashi Arukeyo Otome

animes.tags: Comedy, Harem, School, Satire, Romance
animes.title: Ouran Koukou Host Club

animes.tags: Awesome style, tense action, and a vivid cast of carnies make up for the lackluster story.
animes.title: Kuroshitsuji: Book of Circus

animes.tags: Happy themes of belonging and friendship, happy characters, forgettable story. Annoying romance.
animes.title: Sakura-sou no Pet na Kanojo

animes.tags: What happens after we die? Who knows... But this show is so fucking awful that it might push you to find the answer yourself.
animes.title: Angel Beats!

animes.tags: Really satisfying conclusion, much better than the first movie.
animes.title: Cardcaptor Sakura Movie 2: Fuuin Sareta Card

animes.tags: Superb comedy that draws in the viewers with the expressive characters but reveals that it has a level of depth which requires your undivided attention.
animes.title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Comedy wa Machigatteiru. Zoku

animes.tags: A stock shoujo drama with pretty art and a cast of varied, nuanced characters. Sentimental enough to be impactful and it avoids being sappy. It evolves the longer it goes, giving deeper meaning to the everything that came before it.
animes.title: Fruits Basket 1st Season

animes.tags: Comedy, School, Action, Shounen
animes.title: Ansatsu Kyoushitsu

animes.tags: Forced drama and a disjointed dating sim story, oh boy.
animes.title: Clannad

animes.tags: Better
animes.title: Karakai Jouzu no Takagi-san 2

animes.tags: Does what Twin Peaks did to the crime/SoL genre to the magical girl genre. It balances many characters and story threads with talent and expertise. Fantastic visuals to complement the uplifting tone. So well written!!! Formulaic but good.
animes.title: Cardcaptor Sakura

animes.tags: Similar to Kaleido Star, with more of a fantasy element and more metaphorical.
animes.title: Princess Tutu

animes.tags: Really really really good. High-key feminist themes, plenty of symbolism to read into. Utena's a great main character. Looks and sounds better than most anime we'd see today. Was this really made on the same budget as Eva??
animes.title: Shoujo Kakumei Utena

animes.tags: Fan service…
animes.title: Nisemonogatari

animes.tags: So you wanna be an animator? This has the potential to be anime of the season. It's ambitious, fun, thoughtful, gorgeous and god damn that music is good.
animes.title: Eizouken ni wa Te wo Dasu na!

animes.tags: Cute, light entertainment, hampered by a heavy helping of sexual assault on a toddler.
animes.title: Kobayashi-san Chi no Maid Dragon
Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Comedy wa Machigatteiru. Zoku OVA

animes.tags: Not gay enough
animes.title: Yuri!!! on Ice

animes.tags: Mean spirited comedy can be funny, but the jokes are so repetitive. Add Studio Deen visuals into the mix and you’ve got a recipe mediocrity.
animes.title: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!

animes.tags: Scifi setting inspires imagination. Nice commentary on technology to keep you engaged. Good portrayal of kids. Fairly simple character designs. Washed out color palette and soft visuals, Review
animes.title: Dennou Coil

animes.tags: Hilarious and subversive, all of the characters are great. The dub makes it even better. Spot on comedic timing.
animes.title: Gekkan Shoujo Nozaki-kun

animes.tags: The worst aspects of this series put into a special.
animes.title: Kokoro Connect: Michi Random

animes.tags: Fantasy, School, Comedy
animes.title: Little Witch Academia (TV)

animes.tags: Fantasy, Action, Drama
animes.title: Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood

animes.tags: The most overrated anime on MAL. I guess pretty visuals are enough for people to forget about logic. The first half is a watchable, but mediocre, cutesy comedy with poor characterization. Holy shit though, it falls apart at the by the end.
animes.title: Kimi no Na wa.

animes.tags: Oh my god the giant cgi titan is looks so fucking stupid, this is pure comedy. MAL is right, best season yet.
animes.title: Shingeki no Kyojin Season 3 Part 2

animes.tags: Beautiful and emotional, but very crude and blunt. Overlong final act. Could have been shorter.
animes.title: Koe no Katachi

animes.tags: It made me cry and taught me lessons pretty well.  That might not be enough for some, but it was for me. Will rewatch.
animes.title: Clannad: After Story

animes.tags: Unless you're under the control Lelouch's Geass, I can't see why you'd like this new season. Nonsensical plot, stilted dialogue, characters reduced to sex objects, hilariously bad. Saved by the ending.
animes.title: Code Geass: Hangyaku no Lelouch R2

animes.tags: Need to rewatch
animes.title: Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi

animes.tags: A spectacular first chapter that inspires an equal amount of wonder and fear with its well realized setting. Potentially my favorite survival series to date. It captures what I believe 'growing up' is, Review
animes.title: Made in Abyss

animes.tags: Cuteness doesn't preclude emotional manipulation. Lacking the subtly and tact required for the sensitive subject matter. Overwritten and pretentious monologues that condescends to the audience. Either a 3 or a 4 haven't decided yet
animes.title: Shigatsu wa Kimi no Uso

animes.tags:
Fun time, but great characters and a good sense of tone.
 A sci-fi classic that goes beyond anime.
animes.title: Cowboy Bebop

animes.tags: Addictive YA "fight the power" resistance story. Fun enough to be watchable but it's self confidence isn't backed up by thoughtful results.
animes.title: Code Geass: Hangyaku no Lelouch

animes.tags: Adult humor for teenagers, entertaining camp with melodrama throughout. Not particularly deep in any way and the art is mediocre for the time it was released. Repetitive, but an easy watch with great comedy.
animes.title: Great Teacher Onizuka

animes.tags: Intense. Filled with tension and emotion. Well paced story, gradually unfolding mystery. Great subplots and characters, constantly moving but always in a purposeful direction. Barely even anime. Nothing is perfect, but this is as close as we'll get.
animes.title: Monster

animes.tags: Fantastic direction that got me to care about an art I would otherwise ignore. Some of Deen's best visuals. Great likable characters that grow in clear ways.
animes.title: Shouwa Genroku Rakugo Shinjuu

animes.tags: An atmospheric masterpiece. Immersive and emotionally consuming. Every facet of it is working in high gear to convey a feeling. Active commentary on mental disabilities, Violet is excellently portrayed, Review
animes.title: Violet Evergarden
Steins;Gate Movie: Fuka Ryouiki no Déjà vu

animes.tags: IGGY!!!!
animes.title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 3: Stardust Crusaders 2nd Season

animes.tags: "I cute girl, I ded, you cry now."
animes.title: Ano Hi Mita Hana no Namae wo Bokutachi wa Mada Shiranai.

animes.tags: Nice action, great animation, simple plot. The cast of angsty teenagers is so annoying and boring, thankfully most of them are cannon fodder to be killed.
animes.title: Shingeki no Kyojin

animes.tags: Even after all these years, I still love it. Probably even more than I did before. Great rewatch value.
animes.title: Shinsekai yori

animes.tags: I could praise its technical achievement for years, but at the end of the day, the feeling it conveys is indescribable. Like the gems themselves, the show also traverses new narrative depths finding oddly impactful but unrecognizable emotions, Review
animes.title: Houseki no Kuni (TV)

animes.tags: A better ending than the original in every way. It makes use of the potential built up through the series first 24 episodes. It does also linger more on some aspects of the prequel that I didn't care for.
animes.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion
Mahou Shoujo Madoka★Magica Movie 3: Hangyaku no Monogatari

animes.tags: More unabashedly ridiculous than the first season. It still takes itself too seriously, but it's more flashy and fun.
animes.title: Shingeki no Kyojin Season 2

animes.tags: Confidentlu directed, but there's not much under the hood. Just pretty but hollow visuals that are dynamically presented. Good melodrama, but that's all I found. Likable characters.
animes.title: Mahou Shoujo Madoka★Magica

animes.tags: Mediocre take on a classic story setup. Some really interesting themes tied to Joe's rise through Megalonia, but they're dropped entirely by the end, Review
animes.title: Megalo Box

animes.tags: Handles fragile themes with incredible care and panache, avoiding the genre pitfals that shows like "Your Lie in April" fall into. Undoubtedly great, but the second half isn't as good as the first. Some wasted characters/not enough development.
animes.title: 3-gatsu no Lion

animes.tags: Mind numbing wish fulfillment Isekai fantasy that hides behind a cool but ultimately undercooked 'reset the day' hook. All of the girls are loli faux subversive archetypes. The MC has a decent arc. Very heavy handed symbolism.
animes.title: Re:Zero kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu

animes.tags: The last work from many KyoAni talents. One of the best chapters of Violet Evergarden. An essential.
animes.title: Violet Evergarden Gaiden: Eien to Jidou Shuki Ningyou

animes.tags: Drama, Comedy, Psychological, Romance
animes.title: NHK ni Youkoso!

animes.tags: Happy themes of belonging and friendship, happy characters, forgettable story. Annoying romance.
animes.title: Sakura-sou no Pet na Kanojo

animes.tags: Fantastic psychological horror
animes.title: Perfect Blue

animes.tags: What happens after we die? Who knows... But this show is so fucking awful that it might push you to find the answer yourself.
animes.title: Angel Beats!

animes.tags: Really satisfying conclusion, much better than the first movie.
animes.title: Cardcaptor Sakura Movie 2: Fuuin Sareta Card

animes.tags: Superb comedy that draws in the viewers with the expressive characters but reveals that it has a level of depth which requires your undivided attention.
animes.title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Comedy wa Machigatteiru. Zoku

animes.tags: The sleeper hit of the season, a conventional BL plot that avoids the genre's negative connotations. Executed nicely with lerche's presentation and much needed good music.
animes.title: Given

animes.tags: Occasionally funny but usually filled with annoying angst and edgy world logic. Incredibly undercooked characters, but it masquerades this with a laughably stupid “mystery”. Could have been enjoyable but instead it’s boring and stupid.
animes.title: Death Parade

animes.tags: wtf it's just a recap... why does this have such a high score?
animes.title: Mahou Shoujo Madoka★Magica Movie 1: Hajimari no Monogatari

animes.tags: Once again Shinkai reaches for profoundness and ends in pretty but ultimately too heavy handed and poorly written to deserve its dramatic climaxes.
animes.title: Kotonoha no Niwa

animes.tags: Cool!
animes.title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 3: Stardust Crusaders

animes.tags: Nice music, good visuals, washed out color palette, good drama thanks to simple characters. Cute, funny, sweet, but it's not easy to suspend my disbelief because the intriguing setting isn't developed well.
animes.title: Nagi no Asu kara

animes.tags: A stock shoujo drama with pretty art and a cast of varied, nuanced characters. Sentimental enough to be impactful and it avoids being sappy. It evolves the longer it goes, giving deeper meaning to the everything that came before it.
animes.title: Fruits Basket 1st Season

animes.tags: A beautiful film from Mari Okada that bears her brand of melodrama, one of her more successful works. The impactful themes are undercut by the lacking narrative/world building, however it still manages to be poignant.
animes.title: Sayonara no Asa ni Yakusoku no Hana wo Kazarou

animes.tags: Forced drama and a disjointed dating sim story, oh boy.
animes.title: Clannad

animes.tags: Does what Twin Peaks did to the crime/SoL genre to the magical girl genre. It balances many characters and story threads with talent and expertise. Fantastic visuals to complement the uplifting tone. So well written!!! Formulaic but good.
animes.title: Cardcaptor Sakura

animes.tags: The aesthetic is unlike anything I've ever seen. It pulls you into the show like a trap and, just like the titular Count himself, you're faced with deeply affecting moments.
animes.title: Gankutsuou

animes.tags: Similar to Kaleido Star, with more of a fantasy element and more metaphorical.
animes.title: Princess Tutu

animes.tags: Really really really good. High-key feminist themes, plenty of symbolism to read into. Utena's a great main character. Looks and sounds better than most anime we'd see today. Was this really made on the same budget as Eva??
animes.title: Shoujo Kakumei Utena
